conclusion: Temperature of gas in state A is 300K
Pressure at state A is 4 atm, Volume at state A is 10 L
Pressure at state B is 4 atm, Volume at state B is 20 L
Process from A to B is isobaric because pressure is constant
Ideal gas law equation is pV = nRT
Number of moles n is constant because mass of gas is constant
Applying ideal gas law to state A: p_A V_A = nRT_A
Applying ideal gas law to state B: p_B V_B = nRT_B
Divide equation for state B by equation for state A: (p_B V_B)/(p_A V_A) = (nRT_B)/(nRT_A)
Since p_A = p_B, simplify to V_B/V_A = T_B/T_A
Plug values into equation: (20 L)/(10 L) = T_B/300 K
